title: Unknown game: "Biff Proton"?
content:
I posted this on another forum, but I figure it's pertinent here as much as anywhere else:

The full title of the game I'm referring to is "Biff Proton in Killing Time". I've spent quite some time now looking for information on this title, but I've had no luck at all in finding any. I discovered the game on some Polish(?) abandonware site; I'd give a link to it, but the mods would get upset and remove it anyways. Anyhow, there was Biff Proton, shoved in right between Hovertank 3D and the Catacombs trilogy. The only information is this chunk I ran through an online translator:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Biff Proton in Killing Time is a play, which I came over here completely on accident; a acquaintence of my father gave it a number of old disks, and this play was on one of them. I have never all possible information about it found differently than, which gave few the play me. It is credited, how develops from Dark Castle Softworks, but the InterNet seems to have no information about it. Possibly is this, how the Legend of the Seven Paladins, close-release play of a small developer, that went under it?[hr][/quote]
As far as I can gather from this, the guy's dad got a bundle of floppy disks from a friend of his, and the kid found the game on one of them. I looked up Dark Castle Softworks, but like the guy said, nothing. So I'm one to jump on the boat that this was from some small developer that went belly up before it came out. Although what really puzzles me is how this looks to be directly based off of the Hovertank 3D engine, yet nobody from Softdisk or iD seems to acknowledge the existence of this game.

Here are a few screencaps I took:
[img]http://www.zxdware.net/biffp_000.PNG[/img]
[img]http://www.zxdware.net/biffp_001.PNG[/img]
[img]http://www.zxdware.net/biffp_002.PNG[/img]
[img]http://www.zxdware.net/biffp_003.PNG[/img]

title: Bizarre...
content: Looks like a very strange game. I've never heard of it, and a Google search for "biff proton" "killing time" brings up zilch. Nice find!

content: I'd give a link, but the website I got it from was distributing illegal copies of games, and I'm not sure how copyright laws apply to this game; if it was released and is just incredibly obscure, then it's illegal to put it up and thus I couldn't link it here.  If it's a leak, I'm fairly certain that that would be illegal to put up a link to as well.  (But I'm not sure on that.)

Flaose mars LordOfGlobox's post for continuing to make stupid assumptions.

Firstly, the "higher ups" that you speak of no longer exist on this site. If they did check this place out, they probably wouldn't bother to log onto the mod channel to delete it anyways.

Secondly, I agree with Frenkel. The pictures up above were either edited by you or someone else to look authentic. I know what real images look like, and all of those images are barren of any real objects other than 1 enemy and 1 item, plus a easily changed, non-wallpaper, walls... Or, this was a really shitty project.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: Hehe
content:
Since it's been spoiled at both forums it exists on, I present the same response here as elsewhere:

Curse you, Frenkel! You had to spoil my fun!

It was, in fact, both. I posted this an hour or so before midnight my time (CST), using screenshots from an only partially finished game. The joke got way out of hand, and I was trying frantically to get it done before anyone figured me out. I went so far as to make a "Dark Castle Softworks" logo to replace my personal logo on the game. No, actually. The joke went too far when I grudgingly registered a Polish webhost in case somebody ever demanded to see the website. Still, the game is still in production and should hopefully be out in the near future. I hope nobody's upset that this isn't really a lost piece of history, and that any and all interested parties will still have a look when this officially comes out.

title: Re: Hehe
content: Hover and Hovertank 3D are completely unrelated.  I've had and played both: Hover is, as Shadow Master said, about capturing all the enemy flags.  Hovertank 3D is recovering hostages and killing monsters before the time runs out.
